settings.title: Settings
settings.apiKeyRequired: API key required for chat and QA features
settings.apiKeyDescription: To enable chat and QA functionality, please provide an API key from your selected provider.
settings.resetSettingsConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset all settings? This action cannot be undone.
settings.selectChatModel: Select the Chat model to use
settings.coreFeature: Core Feature: Powers Semantic Search & QA
settings.embeddingDescription: This model converts text into vector representations, essential for semantic search and QA functionality. Changing the embedding model will:
settings.rebuildIndex: Require rebuilding your vault's vector index

chatModeDescription.chat: Regular chat mode for general conversations and tasks. Free to use with your own API key.
chatModeDescription.vaultQA: Ask questions about your vault content with semantic search. Free to use with your own API key.
chatModeDescription.copilotPlus: Covers all features of the 2 free modes, plus advanced paid features including chat context menu, advanced search, AI agents, and more. Check out obsidiancopilot.com for more details.

settings.chooseOpenLocation: Choose where to open the plugin
settings.defaultConversationFolderDesc: The default folder name where chat conversations will be saved. Default is 'copilot-conversations'
settings.customPromptsFolderDesc: The default folder name where custom prompts will be saved. Default is 'copilot-custom-prompts'
settings.defaultConversationTagDesc: The default tag to be used when saving a conversation. Default is 'ai-conversations'
settings.customizeFormat: Customize the format of saved conversation note names.
settings.templateNote: Note: All the following variables must be included in the template.
settings.autosaveChatDesc: Automatically save the chat when starting a new one or when the plugin reloads
settings.suggestedPromptsDesc: Show suggested prompts in the chat view
settings.relevantNotesDesc: Show relevant notes in the chat view
settings.temperatureDescription: Default is 0.1. Higher values will result in more creativeness, but also more mistakes. Set to 0 for no randomness.
settings.tokenLimitDescription1: The maximum number of output tokens to generate. Default is 1000.
settings.tokenLimitDescription2: This number plus the length of your prompt (input tokens) must be smaller than the context window of the model.
settings.conversationTurnsDescription: The number of previous conversation turns to include in the context. Default is 15 turns, i.e. 30 messages.

copilotPlus.title: Copilot Plus (beta)
copilotPlus.description: Copilot Plus takes your Obsidian experience to the next level with cutting-edge AI capabilities. This premium tier unlocks advanced features, including chat context, PDF and image support, web search integration, exclusive chat and embedding models, and much more.
copilotPlus.betaNotice: Currently in beta, Copilot Plus is evolving fast, with new features and improvements rolling out regularly. Join now to secure the lowest price and get early access!

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.reasoning: This model supports general reasoning tasks.
capabilities.websearch: This model can access the internet.

autoIndexStrategy.title: Auto-Index Strategy
autoIndexStrategy.description: Decide when you want the vault to be indexed.
autoIndexStrategy.tooltipHeading: Choose when to index your vault:

never.title: NEVER
never.description: Manual indexing via command or refresh only

onStartup.title: ON STARTUP
onStartup.description: Index updates when plugin loads or reloads

autoIndexStrategy.warning: Warning: Cost implications for large vaults with paid models

maxSources.title: Max Sources
maxSources.description: Copilot goes through your vault to find relevant blocks and passes the top N blocks to the LLM. Default for N is 3. Increase if you want more sources included in the answer generation step.

requestsPerMinute.title: Requests per Minute
requestsPerMinute.description: Default is 90. Decrease if you are rate limited by your embedding provider.

embeddingBatchSize.title: Embedding Batch Size
embeddingBatchSize.description: Default is 16. Increase if you are rate limited by your embedding provider.

numPartitions.title: Number of Partitions
numPartitions.description: Number of partitions for Copilot index. Default is 1. Increase if you have issues indexing large vaults. Warning: Changes require clearing and rebuilding the index!

exclusions.title: Exclusions
exclusions.description: Exclude folders, tags, note titles or file extensions from being indexed. Previously indexed files will remain until a force re-index is performed.

inclusions.title: Inclusions
inclusions.description: Index only the specified paths, tags, or note titles. Exclusions take precedence over inclusions. Previously indexed files will remain until a force re-index is performed.

enableIndexSync.title: Enable Obsidian Sync for Copilot index
enableIndexSync.description: If enabled, the index will be stored in the .obsidian folder and synced with Obsidian Sync by default. If disabled, it will be stored in .copilot-index folder at vault root.

disableIndexOnMobile.title: Disable index loading on mobile
disableIndexOnMobile.description: When enabled, Copilot index won't be loaded on mobile devices to save resources. Only chat mode will be available. Any existing index from desktop sync will be preserved. Uncheck to enable QA modes on mobile.

commandSettings.title: Custom Commands
commandSettings.description: To trigger a custom command, highlight text in the editor and select it from the command palette, or right-click and choose it from the context menu if configured.
commandSettings.noModifiedCommandHint: Take control of your inline edit commands! You can now create your own or edit built-in ones to tailor functionality to your needs.
commandSettings.name: Name
commandSettings.promptHelp: Use {"copilot-selection"} as a placeholder for the selected text. If not included, the selected text will be appended to the prompt.

errors.emptyIndexError:
Copilot index does not exist. Please index your vault first!

1. Set a working embedding model in QA settings. If it's not a local model, don't forget to set the API key. 

2. Click 'Refresh Index for Vault' and wait for indexing to complete. If you encounter the rate limiting error, please turn your request per second down in QA setting.
